I am Terra your personal travel assistant. I'll walk you through different destinations of Mysore, which is also known as the birthplace of proud kings.Mostly famous for it's grand palaces with intricate and vibrant architecture.

patterns: I want to know more about Mysore
responses: The alluring city of Mysore is located in the state of Karnataka.It is also well-connected to cities like Chennai, Cochin, Kottayam, Mumbai, Goa, Coorg and Ooty.Want to know more?

Mysore was the capital of the Wodeyar kings who ruled over the Mysore Kingdom for many centuries. Wodeyars were great patrons of art and music and have contributed significantly to make Mysore a cultural centre.Culture of Mysore is a fine combination of the historic heritage and the contemporary achievements of the city. The continuous patronage and support of the Kings in every field led to the evolution of a distinct style known as the 'Mysore Style' in the all the fields like painting, architecture, music, poetry etc.
No problem
Winter season which lasts from October till the end of February, is recommended for you to visit Mysore
The best time to visit is during the winter season which lasts from October till the end of February.

patterns: How can I go to Mysore
responses: You can reach Bangalore International Airport which has frequent flights known as Kempegowda International Airport, has daily flights to cities in India like Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Cochin, Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Coimbatore, Chandigarh and Pune. IndiGo, SpiceJet, Air India, Jet Airways, TruJet and Vistara are a few of the airlines operating on these routes.Bangalore is about 139 km away from Mysore.You can reach there by train, bus or a cab

patterns: How to get a bus to Mysore?
responses: The Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) runs a lot of deluxe, semi-deluxe and ordinary buses to Mysore, from Bangalore. A lot of privately-operated buses also ply this route like Kallada Suresh Travels, Poornima Tours and Ashwini Tours and Travels.

patterns: How to reach Mysore using train?
Which station should I get down?
responses: The Mysore Junction is a railway station that is a part of the South Western Railway in India. Trains originating from different parts of the country halt at this prominent railway station. There are daily trains connecting Mysore to Bangalore. Mumbai, Jaipur, Varanasi, Kolkata, Chennai, Tuticorin, Tirupati, Ajmer and Hubli are the other cities connected to Mysore via the rail network.
Places to vist are the Mysore grand palace, Chamundeshwari Temple, Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens, St. Philomena’s Church, Jaganmohan Palace, Brindavan garden and Various Museums.

patterns: I want to know more about culture of Mysore
responses: Mysore City is known as the cultural capital of Karnataka.The Kings supported in every field led to the evolution of a distinct style known as the 'Mysore Style' in the all the fields like painting, architecture, music, poetry etc.The Mysore Dashera is a ten day long festival celebrated in the month of September or October,the Vairamudi Brahmotsavam is a 13 day-long celebration usually takes place in March or April annually, and attracts a large number of devotees,the Panchalinga Darshana festival is a five-day festival is held on the new moon day in the month of Kartika according to the Hindu calendar.To know more about each festival explore our gallery.

patterns: What is the history of Mysore?
I want to know the history of Mysore
responses: The name Mysuru(Mysore) finds its roots from Mahishasura, who was a demon who had the ability to take the form of buffalo and human. It is believed that this area was ruled by the demon Mahishasura who was killed by the Goddess Chamundeshwari, whose temple is over the hills. This is how the city was named Mysore.The history of the city dates back to 2nd Century starting from Ganga Dynasty, the Cholas and the Yadu Dynasty,who ruled over the city.A feudatory of the Vijaynagar Empire, the Yadu dynasty contributed significantly to the development of Mysore.To know more explore our gallery

The Palace is famous for the rich culture and architectural history. The Mysore palace is a highlight of the architecture and reflects Hindu, Rajput, Islamic and Gothic style of architecture. Located in the heart of the city, it has two Darbar halls, garden, and buildings. It is the official residence of the rulers of Mysore.

The Chamundeshwari temple,located in the outskirts of Mysore,on the Chamundi Hills is one of the most sacred hills in India. The Chamundeshwari Temple is situated at the top of the hill. You can get a breathtaking view of the city from the top of the hills.
Main Deity: Goddess Chamundeshwari
Best Time to Visit: October during the Dasara
Temple Timings: 7.30 am to 9.00 pm
Entry Fee: Free
Visit Duration:1-2 hours

One of the oldest zoo in India is the Mysore Zoo. It has a huge plantation and houses white tigers, rhinos and gorillas. It is one of the popular tourist attractions in the city.Timings: All days except Tuesday between 8.30 AM to 5.30 PM.
Duration of Visit: 2 to 3 hours
Best time to Visit: Before 11 AM or after 3 PM
The fees ranges from Rs 50-70 for adults and Rs 20-30 for children

St. Philomena’s Church in Mysore is considered to be the second largest church in Asia. This Roman Catholic Church was built to honor the memory of Saint Philomena, a Latin Catholic Saint and martyr of the Roman Catholic Church. Located in the northern part of the city, St. Philomena’s Church is the most famous address on the ever-busy Ashoka Road of Mysore.

Jaganmohan Palace is one of the majestic palaces that enhance the glory of the princely state of Mysore.The palace has been witness to many important events in the history of Mysore. Jaganmohan Palace now acts as an art gallery and a function hall.
Timing: 8.30 AM to 5.30 PM on all days of the week (Tickets issued up to 5 PM)
Entrance Fee: Adult – Rs.20.00 and Children (5 to 10 years old) – Rs.10.00

Brindavan Gardens is a famous garden in India. Situated next to the Krishnaraja Sagar Dam, the gardens house a dancing fountain which is a major tourist attraction. A light and sound show is conducted every evening, which adds colour to the beautiful gardens
Timings: 6.30 AM to 8.00 PM
Entry Fee: INR 15/- per adults and INR 5/- per children between 5 and 10
Music Foundation Show: 6.30 pm to 7.30 pm
Visit Duration: 2 to 3 hours
Kori Gassi,Payasam,Bisibelabath,Shavige Bath,Mysore pak,Poori Saagu,Uttapam,Kesari Bath and Mysore masala dosa are some of the famous dishes you can enjoy

patterns: What can I buy in Mysore
responses: Mysore is famous for Silk sarees,Khadi cotton,Coffee,Mysore pak,Sandalwood products,Mysore paintings,Rosewood souvenirs,Wooden toys and stone sculptures
